response.overview: Lewis Liu is a phenomenal director interviewing filmmakers who have come to film school in the US. The excitement is thrilling to watch and so are their stories. Seeing their dreams come to life on camera in their films makes it worth it in the end. See the passion and excitement that everyone is talking about in Lewis Liu's "Drifiting in Los Angeles." From a filmmaker getting his car with all his film gear towed away. The show must go on. Even in Los Angeles from the hiking trails under the Hollywood sign. There is always a dream. This is a must-see and best movie of the year. See it at www.montageplay.com
response.tagline: A fun and light hearted short film about the effects of internet and people in a cafe's reliance on WiFi.
response.title: Drifting in Los Angeles
